content: 1 The Song of Songs､ which pertaineth to Solomon.
content_old: 1 The Song of Songs､ which pertaineth to Solomon.

content: 2 Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth! For better are thy caresses than wine:
content_old: 2 Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth! For better are thy caresses than wine:

content: 3 Like the fragrance of thy precious oils Oil poured out is thy name, For this cause virgins love thee.
content_old: 3 Like the fragrance of thy precious oils Oil poured out is thy name, For this cause virgins love thee.

content: 4 Draw me! After thee will we run! The king hath brought me into his chambers. We will exult and rejoice in thee, We will mention thy caresses､ beyond wine, Sincerely they love thee.
content_old: 4 Draw me! After thee will we run! The king hath brought me into his chambers. We will exult and rejoice in thee, We will mention thy caresses､ beyond wine, Sincerely they love thee.

content: 5 Swarthy I am but comely､ Ye daughters of Jerusalem. Like the tents of Kedar, Like the curtains of Solomon.
content_old: 5 Swarthy I am but comely､ Ye daughters of Jerusalem. Like the tents of Kedar, Like the curtains of Solomon.

content: 6 Do not look on me､ Because I am so swarthy, Because the sun hath scorched me,— My mother’s sons were angry with me､ They set me to keep the vineyards, Mine own vineyard have I not kept.…
content_old: 6 Do not look on me､ Because I am so swarthy, Because the sun hath scorched me,— My mother’s sons were angry with me､ They set me to keep the vineyards, Mine own vineyard have I not kept.…

content: 7 Tell me､ thou loved of my soul! Where wilt thou pasture thy flock? Where wilt thou let them recline at noon? For why should I be as one that wrappeth a veil about her､ by the flocks of thy companions?
content_old: 7 Tell me､ thou loved of my soul! Where wilt thou pasture thy flock? Where wilt thou let them recline at noon? For why should I be as one that wrappeth a veil about her､ by the flocks of thy companions?

content: 8 If thou know not of thyself, Most beautiful among women! Get thee forth in the footsteps of the flock､ And pasture thy kids by the huts of the shepherds.…
content_old: 8 If thou know not of thyself, Most beautiful among women! Get thee forth in the footsteps of the flock､ And pasture thy kids by the huts of the shepherds.…

content: 9 To a mare of mine､ in the chariots of Pharaoh Have I likened thee､ my fair one!
content_old: 9 To a mare of mine､ in the chariots of Pharaoh Have I likened thee､ my fair one!

content: 10 Comely are Thy cheeks､ with bead-rows, Thy neck､ with strings of gems.
content_old: 10 Comely are Thy cheeks､ with bead-rows, Thy neck､ with strings of gems.

content: 11 Rows of golden ornaments will we make thee, With studs of silver.
content_old: 11 Rows of golden ornaments will we make thee, With studs of silver.

content: 12 By the time the king is in his circle My nard will have given out its fragrance:
content_old: 12 By the time the king is in his circle My nard will have given out its fragrance:

content: 13 A bag of myrrh is my beloved to me, Between my breasts shall it tarry the night!
content_old: 13 A bag of myrrh is my beloved to me, Between my breasts shall it tarry the night!

content: 14 A cluster of henna is my beloved to me, In the vineyards of En-gedi.
content_old: 14 A cluster of henna is my beloved to me, In the vineyards of En-gedi.

content: 15 Lo! thou art beautiful､ my fair one, Lo! thou art beautiful､ Thine eyes are doves!
content_old: 15 Lo! thou art beautiful､ my fair one, Lo! thou art beautiful､ Thine eyes are doves!

content: 16 Lo! thou art beautiful､ my beloved､ Yea delightful! Yea! our couch is covered with leaves:
content_old: 16 Lo! thou art beautiful､ my beloved､ Yea delightful! Yea! our couch is covered with leaves:

content: 1 I am The meadow-saffron of Sharon, The lily of the valleys.
content_old: 1 I am The meadow-saffron of Sharon, The lily of the valleys.

content: 2 As a lily among thorns So is my fair one､ among the daughters!
content_old: 2 As a lily among thorns So is my fair one､ among the daughters!

content: 3 As an apple-tree among the trees of the forest So is my beloved､ among the sons: In his shade I greatly delighted and sat down, And his fruit was sweet to my taste.
content_old: 3 As an apple-tree among the trees of the forest So is my beloved､ among the sons: In his shade I greatly delighted and sat down, And his fruit was sweet to my taste.

content: 4 He hath brought me into the house of wine, And his banner over me is love.
content_old: 4 He hath brought me into the house of wine, And his banner over me is love.

content: 5 Sustain me with raisin-cakes, Refresh me with apples,— For sick with love I am.
content_old: 5 Sustain me with raisin-cakes, Refresh me with apples,— For sick with love I am.

content: 6 His left hand under my head Then his right hand embraceth me!
content_old: 6 His left hand under my head Then his right hand embraceth me!

content: 7 I adjure you､ ye daughters of Jerusalem､ By the gazelles or by the hinds of the field,— That ye wake not､ nor arouse､ the dear love until she please!
content_old: 7 I adjure you､ ye daughters of Jerusalem､ By the gazelles or by the hinds of the field,— That ye wake not､ nor arouse､ the dear love until she please!

content: 8 The voice of my beloved! Lo! here he cometh,— Leaping over the mountains, Skipping over the hills.
content_old: 8 The voice of my beloved! Lo! here he cometh,— Leaping over the mountains, Skipping over the hills.

content: 9 Resembleth､ my beloved､ a gazelle, Or a young stag,— Lo! here he is､ standing behind our wall, Looking in at the windows, Peeping in at the lattice.
content_old: 9 Resembleth､ my beloved､ a gazelle, Or a young stag,— Lo! here he is､ standing behind our wall, Looking in at the windows, Peeping in at the lattice.

content: 10 Responded my beloved､ and said to me,— Rise up! my fair—my beautiful—one, And come away,
content_old: 10 Responded my beloved､ and said to me,— Rise up! my fair—my beautiful—one, And come away,

content: 11 For lo the winter is past,— The rain is over､ and gone;
content_old: 11 For lo the winter is past,— The rain is over､ and gone;

content: 12 The flowers have appeared in the earth, The time of the spring-song hath come,— And the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;
content_old: 12 The flowers have appeared in the earth, The time of the spring-song hath come,— And the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;

content: 13 The fig-tree hath spiced her green figs, And the vines—all blossom yield fragrance,— Rise up! my fair—my beautiful—one､ And come away!
content_old: 13 The fig-tree hath spiced her green figs, And the vines—all blossom yield fragrance,— Rise up! my fair—my beautiful—one､ And come away!

content: 14 O my dove! In the retreats of the crag､ In the hiding-place of the terrace Let me see thy form, Let me hear thy voice,— For thy voice is sweet､ And thy form comely.
content_old: 14 O my dove! In the retreats of the crag､ In the hiding-place of the terrace Let me see thy form, Let me hear thy voice,— For thy voice is sweet､ And thy form comely.

content: 15 Take ye for us､ the foxes, The little foxes that are spoiling the vines,— And our vines are all blossom!
content_old: 15 Take ye for us､ the foxes, The little foxes that are spoiling the vines,— And our vines are all blossom!

content: 16 My beloved is mine､ And I am his, He that pastureth among lilies!
content_old: 16 My beloved is mine､ And I am his, He that pastureth among lilies!

content: 1 Upon my couch､ in the night-time sought I the beloved of my soul,— I sought him､ but found him not.
content_old: 1 Upon my couch､ in the night-time sought I the beloved of my soul,— I sought him､ but found him not.

content: 2 Come! I must arise､ and go about in the city､ In the paths and in the broadways, I must seek the beloved of my soul,— I sought him､ but found him not.
content_old: 2 Come! I must arise､ and go about in the city､ In the paths and in the broadways, I must seek the beloved of my soul,— I sought him､ but found him not.

content: 3 The watchmen that go round in the city found me, The beloved of my soul have ye seen?
content_old: 3 The watchmen that go round in the city found me, The beloved of my soul have ye seen?

content: 4 Scarcely had I passed from them When I found the beloved of my soul,— I caught him､ and would not let him go, Until that I had brought him into the house of my mother, And into the chamber of her that conceived me.
content_old: 4 Scarcely had I passed from them When I found the beloved of my soul,— I caught him､ and would not let him go, Until that I had brought him into the house of my mother, And into the chamber of her that conceived me.

content: 5 I adjure you､ ye daughters of Jerusalem､ By the gazelles, or by the hinds of the field,— That ye wake not､ nor arouse､ the dear love until she please.
content_old: 5 I adjure you､ ye daughters of Jerusalem､ By the gazelles, or by the hinds of the field,— That ye wake not､ nor arouse､ the dear love until she please.

content: 6 Who is this､ coming up out of the wilderness, Like pillars of smoke,— With perfume of myrrh､ and frankincense, Besides all the aromatic powder of the merchant?
content_old: 6 Who is this､ coming up out of the wilderness, Like pillars of smoke,— With perfume of myrrh､ and frankincense, Besides all the aromatic powder of the merchant?

content: 7 Lo! his couch､ ’tis Solomon’s own, Threescore heroes around it,— Of the heroes of Israel:
content_old: 7 Lo! his couch､ ’tis Solomon’s own, Threescore heroes around it,— Of the heroes of Israel:

content: 8 All of them grasping the sword, Trained for war,— Every man with his sword upon his thigh, Because of dread､ in the night-time.
content_old: 8 All of them grasping the sword, Trained for war,— Every man with his sword upon his thigh, Because of dread､ in the night-time.

content: 9 A palanquin King Solomon made himself, Of the trees of Labanon:
content_old: 9 A palanquin King Solomon made himself, Of the trees of Labanon:

content: 10 The supports thereof made he of silver, The couch thereof of gold､ The seat thereof of purple,— The midst thereof hath an inlay of love From the daughters of Jerusalem.
content_old: 10 The supports thereof made he of silver, The couch thereof of gold､ The seat thereof of purple,— The midst thereof hath an inlay of love From the daughters of Jerusalem.

content: 1 He. Lo! thou art beautiful､ my fair one､ Lo! thou art beautiful, Thine eyes are doves､ from behind thy veil,— Thy hair is like a flock of goats, which are reclining on the sides of Mount Gilead:
content_old: 1 He. Lo! thou art beautiful､ my fair one､ Lo! thou art beautiful, Thine eyes are doves､ from behind thy veil,— Thy hair is like a flock of goats, which are reclining on the sides of Mount Gilead:

content: 2 Thy teeth are like a flock､ evenly grown, which have come up from the washing-place,— Whereof all of them are twin-bearers, and bereaved is none among them:
content_old: 2 Thy teeth are like a flock､ evenly grown, which have come up from the washing-place,— Whereof all of them are twin-bearers, and bereaved is none among them:

content: 3 Like a cord of crimson are thy lips, And thy mouth is lovely,— Like a slice of pomegranate are thy temples､ behind thy veil:
content_old: 3 Like a cord of crimson are thy lips, And thy mouth is lovely,— Like a slice of pomegranate are thy temples､ behind thy veil:

content: 4 Like the tower of David is thy neck, built for war,— A thousand shields hung thereon, All the equipment of heroes:
content_old: 4 Like the tower of David is thy neck, built for war,— A thousand shields hung thereon, All the equipment of heroes:

content: 5 Thy two breasts are like two young roes､ twins of a gazelle,— Which pasture among lilies.
content_old: 5 Thy two breasts are like two young roes､ twins of a gazelle,— Which pasture among lilies.

content: 6 Until the day breathe､ And the shadows be lengthened I will get me unto the mountain of myrrh, And unto the hill of frankincense.
content_old: 6 Until the day breathe､ And the shadows be lengthened I will get me unto the mountain of myrrh, And unto the hill of frankincense.

content: 7 Thou art all over beautiful､ my fair one, And blemish is there none in thee.
content_old: 7 Thou art all over beautiful､ my fair one, And blemish is there none in thee.

content: 8 With me､ from Lebanon O bride, With me､ from Lebanon shalt thou enter,— Thou shalt look round from the top of Amana､ From the top of Senir､ and Hermon, From the dens of lions､ From the mountains of leopards.
content_old: 8 With me､ from Lebanon O bride, With me､ from Lebanon shalt thou enter,— Thou shalt look round from the top of Amana､ From the top of Senir､ and Hermon, From the dens of lions､ From the mountains of leopards.

content: 9 Thou hast encouraged me､ my sister､ bride,— Thou hast encouraged me､ with one glance of thine eyes, With one ornament of thy neck.
content_old: 9 Thou hast encouraged me､ my sister､ bride,— Thou hast encouraged me､ with one glance of thine eyes, With one ornament of thy neck.

content: 10 How beautiful are thy caresses､ my sister､ bride,— How much more delightful thy caresses､ than wine, And the fragrance of thine oils､ than all spices:
content_old: 10 How beautiful are thy caresses､ my sister､ bride,— How much more delightful thy caresses､ than wine, And the fragrance of thine oils､ than all spices:

content: 11 With sweetness thy lips do drip､ O bride,— Honey and milk are under thy tongue, And the fragrance of thy garments is like the fragrance of Lebanon.
content_old: 11 With sweetness thy lips do drip､ O bride,— Honey and milk are under thy tongue, And the fragrance of thy garments is like the fragrance of Lebanon.

content: 12 A garden barred is my sister､ bride,— A spring barred､ A fountain sealed:
content_old: 12 A garden barred is my sister､ bride,— A spring barred､ A fountain sealed:

content: 13 Thy buddings forth are a paradise of pomegranates, With precious fruits,— Henna bushes､ with nard blossoms:
content_old: 13 Thy buddings forth are a paradise of pomegranates, With precious fruits,— Henna bushes､ with nard blossoms:

content: 14 Nard and saffron､ sweet cane and cinnamon, With all woods of frankincense,— Myrrh and aloes, with all the chiefs of spices:
content_old: 14 Nard and saffron､ sweet cane and cinnamon, With all woods of frankincense,— Myrrh and aloes, with all the chiefs of spices:

content: 15 A garden fountain, a well of living waters,— And flowings from Lebanon.
content_old: 15 A garden fountain, a well of living waters,— And flowings from Lebanon.

content: 1 He. I have entered my garden､ my sister､ bride, I have plucked my myrrh､ with my balsam, I have eaten the honey of my thicket, I have drunk my wine､ with my milk:— Eat ye､ O friends, Drink､ yea drink abundantly､ ye beloved!
content_old: 1 He. I have entered my garden､ my sister､ bride, I have plucked my myrrh､ with my balsam, I have eaten the honey of my thicket, I have drunk my wine､ with my milk:— Eat ye､ O friends, Drink､ yea drink abundantly､ ye beloved!

content: 2 I was sleeping､ but my heart was awake,— The voice of my beloved—knocking! Open to me､ my sister､ my fair one､ my dove､ my perfect one, For my head is filled with dew, My locks with the moisture of the night.
content_old: 2 I was sleeping､ but my heart was awake,— The voice of my beloved—knocking! Open to me､ my sister､ my fair one､ my dove､ my perfect one, For my head is filled with dew, My locks with the moisture of the night.

content: 3 I have put off my tunic, oh how shall I put it on? I have bathed my feet､ oh how shall I soil them?
content_old: 3 I have put off my tunic, oh how shall I put it on? I have bathed my feet､ oh how shall I soil them?

content: 4 My beloved thrust in his hand､ at the window, And my feelings were deeply moved for him:
content_old: 4 My beloved thrust in his hand､ at the window, And my feelings were deeply moved for him:

content: 5 I myself arose､ to open to my beloved,— And my hands dripped with myrrh､ And my fingers with myrrh distilling, Upon the handles of the bolt.
content_old: 5 I myself arose､ to open to my beloved,— And my hands dripped with myrrh､ And my fingers with myrrh distilling, Upon the handles of the bolt.

content: 6 I myself opened to my beloved, But my beloved had turned away､ had passed on,— My soul had gone out when he spake, I sought him､ but found him not, I called him､ but he answered not.
content_old: 6 I myself opened to my beloved, But my beloved had turned away､ had passed on,— My soul had gone out when he spake, I sought him､ but found him not, I called him､ but he answered not.

content: 7 The watchmen who were going round in the city found me, They smote me wounded me,— The watchmen of the walls took away my cloak from off me.
content_old: 7 The watchmen who were going round in the city found me, They smote me wounded me,— The watchmen of the walls took away my cloak from off me.

content: 8 I adjure you､ ye daughters of Jerusalem,— If ye find my beloved what will ye tell him? That sick with love I am.
content_old: 8 I adjure you､ ye daughters of Jerusalem,— If ye find my beloved what will ye tell him? That sick with love I am.

content: 9 What is thy beloved more than any other beloved, Thou most beautiful among women? What is thy beloved more than any other beloved, That thus thou hast adjured us?
content_old: 9 What is thy beloved more than any other beloved, Thou most beautiful among women? What is thy beloved more than any other beloved, That thus thou hast adjured us?

content: 10 My beloved is white and ruddy, Conspicuous beyond ten thousand:
content_old: 10 My beloved is white and ruddy, Conspicuous beyond ten thousand:

content: 11 His head is pure gold,— His locks are bushy, black as a raven;
content_old: 11 His head is pure gold,— His locks are bushy, black as a raven;

content: 12 His eyes like doves､ by the channels of water,— Bathing in milk, set as gems in a ring:
content_old: 12 His eyes like doves､ by the channels of water,— Bathing in milk, set as gems in a ring:

content: 13 His cheeks like a raised bed of balsam, Growing plants of perfume,— His lips lilies, dripping with myrrh distilling:
content_old: 13 His cheeks like a raised bed of balsam, Growing plants of perfume,— His lips lilies, dripping with myrrh distilling:

content: 14 His hands cylinders of gold, set with topaz,— His body wrought work of ivory, covered with sapphires:
content_old: 14 His hands cylinders of gold, set with topaz,— His body wrought work of ivory, covered with sapphires:

content: 15 His legs pillars of white marble, founded on sockets of gold,— His form like Lebanon, choice as cedars:
content_old: 15 His legs pillars of white marble, founded on sockets of gold,— His form like Lebanon, choice as cedars:

content: 1 Whither hath thy beloved gone, Thou most beautiful among women? Whither hath thy beloved turned him aside? That we may seek him with thee.
content_old: 1 Whither hath thy beloved gone, Thou most beautiful among women? Whither hath thy beloved turned him aside? That we may seek him with thee.

content: 2 My beloved is gone down to his garden, To the beds of balsam,— To pasture in the gardens, And to gather lilies,
content_old: 2 My beloved is gone down to his garden, To the beds of balsam,— To pasture in the gardens, And to gather lilies,

content: 3 I am my beloved’s､ And my beloved is mine, He that pastureth among lilies.
content_old: 3 I am my beloved’s､ And my beloved is mine, He that pastureth among lilies.

content: 4 Beautiful art thou､ my fair one､ as Tirzah, Comely､ as Jerusalem,— Majestic as bannered hosts!
content_old: 4 Beautiful art thou､ my fair one､ as Tirzah, Comely､ as Jerusalem,— Majestic as bannered hosts!

content: 5 Turn away thine eyes from me, For they have excited me,— Thy hair is like a flock of goats, that are reclining on the sides of Mount Gilead:
content_old: 5 Turn away thine eyes from me, For they have excited me,— Thy hair is like a flock of goats, that are reclining on the sides of Mount Gilead:

content: 6 Thy teeth are like a flock of sheep which have come up from the washing-place,— Whereof all of them are twin-bearers, and bereaved is there none among them:
content_old: 6 Thy teeth are like a flock of sheep which have come up from the washing-place,— Whereof all of them are twin-bearers, and bereaved is there none among them:

content: 7 Like a slice of pomegranate are thy temples, from behind thy veil:
content_old: 7 Like a slice of pomegranate are thy temples, from behind thy veil:

content: 8 Threescore are the queens, And fourscore are the concubines,— And virgins there are､ without number.
content_old: 8 Threescore are the queens, And fourscore are the concubines,— And virgins there are､ without number.

content: 9 One alone is my dove､ my perfect one, One alone was she to her mother, Pure was she to her that bare her,— The daughters have seen her､ and pronounced her happy, Queens and concubines and they have praised her.
content_old: 9 One alone is my dove､ my perfect one, One alone was she to her mother, Pure was she to her that bare her,— The daughters have seen her､ and pronounced her happy, Queens and concubines and they have praised her.

content: 10 Who is this､ that looketh forth like the dawn, Beautiful as the moon､ Pure as the sun, Majestic as bannered hosts?
content_old: 10 Who is this､ that looketh forth like the dawn, Beautiful as the moon､ Pure as the sun, Majestic as bannered hosts?

content: 11 To the garden of nuts I went down, To look at the fresh shoots of the ravine— To see whether had burst forth the vine, had blossomed the pomegranate:—
content_old: 11 To the garden of nuts I went down, To look at the fresh shoots of the ravine— To see whether had burst forth the vine, had blossomed the pomegranate:—

content: 12 I know not how it was my soul set for me the chariots of my willing people!
content_old: 12 I know not how it was my soul set for me the chariots of my willing people!

content: 1 How beautiful are thy feet in sandals､ O daughter of a noble,— The curvings of thy hips are like ornaments wrought by the hands of a skilled workman:
content_old: 1 How beautiful are thy feet in sandals､ O daughter of a noble,— The curvings of thy hips are like ornaments wrought by the hands of a skilled workman:

content: 2 Thy navel is a round bowl, may it not lack spiced wine! Thy body a heap of wheat fenced about with lilies;
content_old: 2 Thy navel is a round bowl, may it not lack spiced wine! Thy body a heap of wheat fenced about with lilies;

content: 3 Thy two breasts are like two young roes､ the twins of a gazelle:
content_old: 3 Thy two breasts are like two young roes､ the twins of a gazelle:

content: 4 Thy neck is like a tower of ivory,— Thine eyes are pools in Heshbon､ by the gate of Bath-rabbim, Thy nose is like the tower of Lebanon､ which looketh towards Damascus:
content_old: 4 Thy neck is like a tower of ivory,— Thine eyes are pools in Heshbon､ by the gate of Bath-rabbim, Thy nose is like the tower of Lebanon､ which looketh towards Damascus:

content: 5 Thy head upon thee is like Carmel, And the hair of thy head is like purple,— The king is held captive by the ringlets!
content_old: 5 Thy head upon thee is like Carmel, And the hair of thy head is like purple,— The king is held captive by the ringlets!

content: 6 How beautiful､ and how delightful O dear love､ for delights:
content_old: 6 How beautiful､ and how delightful O dear love､ for delights:

content: 7 This thy stature is like to a palm-tree, And thy breasts are like clusters:
content_old: 7 This thy stature is like to a palm-tree, And thy breasts are like clusters:

content: 8 I said､ I will ascend the palm-tree, I will lay hold of its fruit stalks— Oh then､ let thy breasts､ I pray thee��� be like vine-clusters, And the fragrance of thy nose like apples;
content_old: 8 I said､ I will ascend the palm-tree, I will lay hold of its fruit stalks— Oh then､ let thy breasts､ I pray thee��� be like vine-clusters, And the fragrance of thy nose like apples;

content: 9 And thy mouth like good wine— She. Flowing to my beloved smoothly､ Gliding over the lips of the sleeping.
content_old: 9 And thy mouth like good wine— She. Flowing to my beloved smoothly､ Gliding over the lips of the sleeping.

content: 10 I am my beloved’s, And unto me is his longing.
content_old: 10 I am my beloved’s, And unto me is his longing.

content: 11 Come､ my beloved､ Let us go forth into the country, Let us stay the night in the villages:
content_old: 11 Come､ my beloved､ Let us go forth into the country, Let us stay the night in the villages:

content: 12 Let us get up early to the vineyards, Let us see whether the vine hath burst forth､ The blossom hath opened, The pomegranates have bloomed,— There will I give my caresses to thee.
content_old: 12 Let us get up early to the vineyards, Let us see whether the vine hath burst forth､ The blossom hath opened, The pomegranates have bloomed,— There will I give my caresses to thee.

content: 1 Oh that thou hadst been a very brother to me, Who had sucked the breasts of my own mother,— Had I found thee without I had kissed thee, Yea folk would not have despised me!
content_old: 1 Oh that thou hadst been a very brother to me, Who had sucked the breasts of my own mother,— Had I found thee without I had kissed thee, Yea folk would not have despised me!

content: 2 I would have guided thee—brought thee into the house of my mother､ Thou wouldst have instructed me,— I would have let thee drink of spiced wine, Of the pressed-out juice of my pomegranate.
content_old: 2 I would have guided thee—brought thee into the house of my mother､ Thou wouldst have instructed me,— I would have let thee drink of spiced wine, Of the pressed-out juice of my pomegranate.

content: 3 His left hand under my head Then his right hand embraceth me.
content_old: 3 His left hand under my head Then his right hand embraceth me.

content: 4 I adjure you､ O ye daughters of Jerusalem,— Why will ye wake､ and why will ye arouse the dear love until she please!
content_old: 4 I adjure you､ O ye daughters of Jerusalem,— Why will ye wake､ and why will ye arouse the dear love until she please!

content: 5 Who is this､ coming up out of the wilderness, Leaning upon her beloved? He. Under the apple-tree I roused thee, Where thy mother was in pain with thee, Where she was in pain who gave thee birth!
content_old: 5 Who is this､ coming up out of the wilderness, Leaning upon her beloved? He. Under the apple-tree I roused thee, Where thy mother was in pain with thee, Where she was in pain who gave thee birth!

content: 6 Set me as a seal､ upon thy heart､ As a seal upon thine arm, For mighty as death is love, Exacting as hades is jealousy,— The flames thereof are flames of fire､ The flash of Yah!
content_old: 6 Set me as a seal､ upon thy heart､ As a seal upon thine arm, For mighty as death is love, Exacting as hades is jealousy,— The flames thereof are flames of fire､ The flash of Yah!

content: 7 Many waters cannot quench love, Nor shall floods overwhelm it,— If a man would give all the substance of his house､ for love They would utterly despise him.
content_old: 7 Many waters cannot quench love, Nor shall floods overwhelm it,— If a man would give all the substance of his house､ for love They would utterly despise him.

content: 8 A sister have we､ a little one, And breasts hath she none,— What shall we do for our sister, In the day when she may be spoken for?
content_old: 8 A sister have we､ a little one, And breasts hath she none,— What shall we do for our sister, In the day when she may be spoken for?

content: 9 If a wall she is we will build upon it a battlement of silver,— But if a door she is we will close it up with a plank of cedar.
content_old: 9 If a wall she is we will build upon it a battlement of silver,— But if a door she is we will close it up with a plank of cedar.

content: 10 I was a wall, and my breasts like towers,— Then became I､ in his eyes､ one who did indeed find good content.
content_old: 10 I was a wall, and my breasts like towers,— Then became I､ in his eyes､ one who did indeed find good content.

content: 11 A vineyard had Solomon､ as the owner of abundance, He put out the vineyard to keepers,— Every man was to bring in､ for the fruit thereof､ a thousand silverlings:
content_old: 11 A vineyard had Solomon､ as the owner of abundance, He put out the vineyard to keepers,— Every man was to bring in､ for the fruit thereof､ a thousand silverlings:

content: 12 Mine own vineyard is before me,— The thousand belong to thee､ O Solomon, And two hundred to the keepers of the fruit thereof.
content_old: 12 Mine own vineyard is before me,— The thousand belong to thee､ O Solomon, And two hundred to the keepers of the fruit thereof.

content: 13 O thou fair dweller in the gardens､ The companions are giving heed to thy voice. Let me hear it.
content_old: 13 O thou fair dweller in the gardens､ The companions are giving heed to thy voice. Let me hear it.
